intro: Hoheria sexstylosa var. sexstylosa, commonly known as the silver mist hoheria, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage that provides a striking contrast to its vibrant yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Ericaceae family and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting native pollinators such as bees and birds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
